author: adria0
content:
Hey <@!393119312350543872>, I'm checking the tests, and I cannot see how do you encode the function call signatures, for instance here https://github.com/ethereum/tests/blob/0e8d25bb613cab7f9e99430f970e1e6cbffdbf1a/src/GeneralStateTestsFiller/VMTests/vmArithmeticTest/addFiller.yml#L103 you define the `- :label add_1_neg1    :abi f(uint) 4`  but when the test is generated in  https://github.com/ethereum/tests/blob/0e8d25bb613cab7f9e99430f970e1e6cbffdbf1a/GeneralStateTests/VMTests/vmArithmeticTest/add.json#L244 I see that the function signature is `693c6139` , but if I try to encode with remix it says that is `"b3de648b": "f(uint256)"`.

Any tricky thing here?

author: adria0
content: AFAIK `uint` is just an alias of `uint256` , so `:abi f(uint) 4`  should be transformed into `:abi f(uint256) 4`
